concept-wr.title: Networks for a Standard System with Dedicated Storage
concept-wr.shortdesc: For a system that uses dedicated storage, Wind River recommends a full network configuration.

conbody.p: Titanium Server systems with dedicated storage include storage hosts to provide Ceph-backed block storage. Network loading is moderate to high, depending on the number of compute hosts, VMs, and storage clusters. The following network configuration typically meets the requirements of such a system:

li.p: An infrastructure network (required for systems with storage hosts)
if the internal management network is required to be on a VLAN-tagged network
or, if the internal management network is shared with other equipment

conbody.p: On moderately loaded systems, the OAM and data networks can be consolidated on the management or infrastructure interfaces.
